title: Invasion of the Dinosaurs
dialogue_disasters: The Doctor's hilarious cockney: 'You're the nark, aren't you? It was you wot grassed on us.'
goofs: The Tyrannosaurus rex has too many fingers on each hand.
Most of the dinosaurs seem to float when CSOed onto film sequences.
In episode two, Yates's disabling disc appears on the Doctor's gun lying in the jeep before he has placed it there.
Martin Jarvis appears to bang his head getting into the lift at the tube station.
In episode four there's a very wobbly zoom towards the security camera.
The metal shutters coming down in the underground base make the walls wobble.
The scenes with Sarah on the 'ship' are intercut with Earth scenes, thus giving the game away that she hasn't been there for several weeks.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: A Time Lord who is largely immune to the effects of Whitaker's machine.
continuity_notes.current_status: Investigating the dinosaur appearances in London

continuity_notes.name: Blinovitch Limitation Effect
continuity_notes.description: A principle that tends to hold back research into time travel.
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentioned by the Doctor as a limitation in time travel research

continuity_notes.name: Florana
continuity_notes.description: Described by the Doctor as 'probably one of the most beautiful planets in the universe'
continuity_notes.current_status: Offered as a potential future destination for Sarah

links: Yates has just got back from leave after the events of 'The Green Death'.
From the Doctor and Sarah's point of view, this story continues directly from 'The Time Warrior'.

locations.name: London
locations.description: The main setting of the story, evacuated due to dinosaur appearances

locations.name: Harrogate
locations.description: The temporary location of the relocated government
locations.current_status: Serving as the temporary seat of government

locations.name: Underground shelter near Whitehall
locations.description: A shelter built during the Cold War, now being used in the crisis
locations.current_status: In use during the dinosaur crisis

future_history: At some point in the future a Chinese scientist, Chung Sen, experiments with time travel.
untold_adventures: The Doctor says that the Vandals were 'quite decent chaps'.
additional_notes: The Doctor takes at least four sugars in his coffee. The Doctor has designed and built a futuristic car (numberplate WVO 2M). Mark jumped 2.362 metres at the last Olympics (Munich, 1972), which would have beaten Dwight Stone's existing world record.
